When you grow up within spitting distance of Hollywood, every mother seems to think her child is the next Harrison Ford. So when I was about 12, my Mom started taking me to all these auditions for things.

Turns out I get this part. They're selling some dish soap or something, and they think it will be magical to have two twelve year old kids dancing ballroom on this fantasy set with clouds and everything. Replies.Reply: Okay, yeah thanks. Now, I want go over a few basic things. First of all, make sure you've all filled out your paperwork with personnel, cause nobody gets paid unless they do. Come to think of it, I suppose it's better for me that you don't fill out your paperwork, then I don't have to pay you. I'll make it optional.
Oh Eddie. Listen, I know you're working but you hold on for just a minute. I've been so busy, and I really gotta go.
Yeahhhah that's cold!
....why you wouldn't believe the things I've heard. Just stupid things. Cutting in line. Demanding special treatment.
Princesses don't carry trash.
I've often thought it was a mistake to have you work here. Maybe I was right.

I'd almost believe that. But I was behind the First Aid station when you said the "princess" line. This park exists because the kids here work hard. They need to be treated fairly. They need to see you are just another lifeguard.
You won't even be that if this continues.
For one thing, start mingling with "the commoners". You'd be amazed at how nice some of the people who work here are.
Good. Work on it. Please?

So. I hear he's pretty good.     Haven't seen him myself yet.

...so then he just disappeared.      I had to call my Dad to come pick me up.

Replies.Reply: When you gonna tell him?
Katie, this is Alex and...

What a couple of losers.
Listen, you're new, so let me tell you how things are. First those guys were wearing blue shorts. That means      Page 30 of 81  concessions.
The Water World social structure is organized on three levels. At the bottom are the Trash Rats.
Bottom feeders. Grounds kids. Babies.
Oooh. Umbrellas.       I've never gotten umbrellas before.

Replies.Reply: Hi there.
Yeah.   Two Blue Crushes please.
So... you're not from around here, huh?

No.
I'm surprised you're not a guard, coming from the ocean and all.
Oh. Good save.
Sure.
Replies.Didascalie: (grabbing ROBBIE's hand and leading out to the dance floor)

Replies.Reply: So. How are things working out at Aokee's?
Well, of course this isn't California...
Really.
You mean the Surfer King?
It's all the other girls seem to talk about. This is my first year, but      Page 44 of 81  apparently it's a pretty big deal. Being from Oceanside, you should have a good chance.
Sure.
So...what made your folks pick up from beautiful southern California and move to Colorado?
Aha...trouble in paradise?
It could be worse.

I have a theory. Sometimes it snows here so hard, that it's a challenge just to get to work or to school. Everything shuts down for a day or so. If your car gets stuck, people appear from nowhere to help pull you out and get you back on the road. Most people here don't just look out for themselves. A lot of times,      Page 46 of 81  they're looking out for you, too.
You were right. This is nice.
But not necessarily quieter.
Eight years at Miss Vickie's Studio of Dance. What surprises me is you.
Of course.
So are you the next Harrison Ford?
Doesn't sound so terrible.     You certainly learned how to dance.
I'm not laughing.
Tiff.
And you're such a good guard...
We'll be going to the same high school.
Staaaannnd Uuuuuuuupppp!
Alex!
Malts?
Because concessions kids can't swim!
Oh, daddy. You know how jealous people get.
But I'm not just another lifeguard.
All right.     What do you expect me to do?
Fine. I'll work it.
Oh, Daddy. Don't worry about a thing.
How good?
That's terrible. You're the Surfer King.
This can't happen.   What are we gonna do?
This may take a lot more than extra practice.
Well, hello Robbie.
Of course I know you. It's my father's park, I try get to know everyone.
Yes, I'm sure you are.
It's been a while since I've been to Aokee's. Do you suppose if I come down in a little while you could make some of that special chicken, what is it?
Yes...and one those smoothies I hear so much about?
It's a date then.    See you later!
Robbie!
Hi Robbie.
How's your team doing?
Well, I think you're going to take care of that tomorrow morning. In fact, I've planned a little celebration in advance.
That's perfect. I'll come back here and pick you up.
Oh, and Robbie...call your mom and tell her you're spending the night at Alex's or something. It's going to be a very special night.
Another summer gone. How about it Robbie? You gonna guard next year?      They could use your help.
You know, that's what I hear. Maybe I should work there next summer.
Maybe you're right.    See you around...
Hello, Eddie.
You know, that's one of the most beautiful things I've ever seen.
Hop in Eddie, let me give you a ride home.
ALEX is talking to Jaffa. JAFFA gestures wildly, as if telling some big mythical story, but at the end throws up his hands as if to say, "I don't know".

Now it is ALEX who has separately come upon the same door, not knowing ROBBIE has already been there. He enters, and the door remains open. We hear girls screaming and he exits quickly, followed by a volley of thrown girl's underwear, swimsuits and towels.

This room is creepy. It is full of loud pumps and large pipes. ROBBIE is making his way through a labyrinth of piping and gauges and the like. He peers and sees a head with a red scarf, but it moves out of view.  Surf music fades.

We are in pitch darkness. We hear the sound of heavy scraping metal. Lights shine and we are looking up through a manhole cover being removed. ROBBIE bends over the hole and hollers "PIPEMAN" and peers in. He shakes his head negatively and moves on.
Hey.   You're not supposed to be in here.
Not on purpose.
No. I just said Pipeman was a better name than Carl.
Oh. OK.   What the hell you doin' down here?
That scrubsink at Aokee's leakin' again?
Everybody wants to be the Surfer King.
What advanced surfing experience?
Ohhh. Bad news, kid. I hate to disappoint you, but this is the reason they call me Pipeman. I'm the plumber around here.
Wait a minute, kid. I do know a little about surfing. I also know a lot about the wave here. What exactly are you looking for from me?
Karate Kid. He works at Big Mike's doesn't he?
Never seen it. Don't know much about this mentor thing. How's it work?
I'm Norman.
No, no NNNNORM-AN. We follow the big fat guy on Cheers reruns.
Usually involves a lot of beer and corn nuts, but I don't think that's gonna work here.
Tell you what.
This is how I trigger the wave.
What did you think? Waves just happen?
You sure that's where you want to be?
Mentors don't get wet. I looked it up.
Get ready.
Want to know what you did wrong?
Oakey doakey.
You're in the wrong position. The wave doesn't crest that soon. Move ten feet further away from the back wall.
OK, now this time, get up on the board more quickly. This is a wave pool and this wave dissipates quickly. You only have a little time to show your stuff.
You get a possible ten points. Three for your surfing, three for your style and four for the judge's overall impression of your ride. No one's ever gotten a ten...I'm not really sure why.

Everybody just surfs, man and tries not to fall. The big reason Cowboy's done so      Page 56 of 81  well is he goes to Hawaii for a couple weeks every year. But there he's mostly a longboarder. Your job is to figure out how to make the most outta this little wave.
You could always go out and do your very best, take a lot of chances and maybe win this thing on merit.
You think you can hold it?
We gotta pull the fin. What do we do about the foot pockets?
What kind of plumber would I be if I didn't have duct tape? Water World      Page 76 of 81  Platinum!   Where do you want them?
Ready!
I'll give 'er all she's got, Cap'n!

Alright, here's the deal. You get three tries; three heats. We judge each run and only your high score counts. If you fall you get no score for the run. Your score will be added to the total for your team, and the winner gets the Surfer King Trophy. Any questions?
Then let's begin. Grounds is up first.

Reading from the rules, "...in the event of a tie at the end of three heats in the surf competition, the teams who are tied will participate in a sudden-death surf off. Additional heats will be run until a winner can be declared."
The "Sudden Death" heat will begin in five minutes.
You want to go first or second?
